meanings.definition: A person who times or records the speed of horses during workouts.
meanings.sent1: The clocker at the racetrack measured how fast the horses were running.
meanings.sent2: The experienced clocker knew exactly when to start and stop the timer for each horse.
meanings.sent3: The clocker chuckled as the horses raced past, trying to beat their own records.
meanings.sent4: The clocker's keen eye caught every detail of the horses' movements, like a hawk hunting its prey.
meanings.sent5: The clocker's job was to be as precise as a surgeon, timing each horse with utmost accuracy.

meanings.definition: A device used to measure time, typically with hands or a digital display.
meanings.sent1: The clocker on the wall chimed every hour to let us know the time.
meanings.sent2: I glanced at the clocker on my wrist to see how much time had passed.
meanings.sent3: The digital clocker beeped loudly, startling everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The antique clocker in the hallway ticked like a heartbeat, marking the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The clocker's hands moved slowly, as if reluctant to show the approaching deadline.

meanings.sent1: She had to clocker each runner's time as they crossed the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The coach asked me to clocker how fast the players were running during practice.
meanings.sent3: I tried to clocker the speed of my cat as she zoomed around the house.
meanings.sent4: The radar gun clocker the pitcher's fastball at an impressive speed.
meanings.sent5: He clocker the car's acceleration, impressed by its quickness.
